txt.en: This journal was written long ago by a dwarf-artisan named Melkólf Stonecarver. It mentions that as he was carving decorative stonework in several of Khâzad-dum's corridors, he left hints to guide his son to the place where he hid his legacy. The journal ends rather abruptly.
'Melkólf...Melkólf...where have I heard that name? I am sure I have seen it somewhere...perhaps on a statue? I can't remember anything else....'
'May I be of service, friend? A journal -- allow me to see it, if you would. Hmm, no...I'm afraid I don't know anything about this....'
'I've no time to be mucking about with journals, my good [placeholder]. An important relic has been discovered to which I must devote my full attention!'
Find a dwarf in the Twenty-first Hall who recognizes the journal
'I'm not sure I can help you, but...have you asked Mögr? He's fascinated with records from the time of mighty Durin.'
Find a dwarf in the Twenty-first Hall who recognizes the journal
